The Cisco PSIRT is a dedicated, global team that manages the receipt, investigation, and public reporting of security vulnerability information that is related to Cisco products and networks. The on-call Cisco PSIRT works 24x7 with Cisco customers, independent security researchers, consultants, industry organizations, and other vendors to identify possible security issues with Cisco products and networks. DocumentNotes.Note:
A vulnerability in the web framework of Cisco Emergency Responder Software could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to execute a stored cross-site scripting (XSS) attack against the user of the web interface.
The vulnerability is due to insufficient validation on the input fields of a web form. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by entering malicious code in an affected form that is then stored in the database.
Cisco has not released software updates that address this vulnerability. Workarounds that mitigate this vulnerability are not available.
This advisory is available at the following link: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20151210-cer["http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20151210-cer"]
